skill.name: labarchive-integration
skill.description: Electronic lab notebook API integration. Access notebooks, manage entries/attachments, backup notebooks, integrate with Protocols.io/Jupyter/REDCap, for programmatic ELN workflows.
skill.summary: Electronic lab notebook API integration. Access notebooks, manage entries/attachments, backup notebo...
skill.author: davila7

security_audit.summary: This is a legitimate LabArchives API integration skill for electronic lab notebook automation. All 264 static findings are false positives caused by the scanner misinterpreting markdown code blocks as shell commands and flagging documentation references to encryption concepts. The actual Python code implements secure credential handling with 0o600 file permissions, makes documented API calls only to LabArchives servers, and performs standard file operations for backups. No malicious patterns, credential exfiltration, or suspicious network behavior detected.

content.value_statement: LabArchives integration enables programmatic access to electronic lab notebooks. Automate data backup, entry creation, and file attachments. Connect scientific tools like Jupyter, Prism, and REDCap for streamlined research documentation.
actual_capabilities: Access LabArchives notebooks programmatically via REST API
Create and manage notebook entries with text and attachments
Backup notebooks to local files in JSON or 7z format
Integrate with Jupyter, Prism, SnapGene, Geneious, and REDCap
Generate site usage reports and analytics for enterprise users
Support US, Australia, and UK regional API endpoints
limitations: Requires Enterprise LabArchives license with API access enabled
Access credentials must be obtained from LabArchives administrator
Rate limited to approximately 60 requests per minute

use_cases.title: Document experimental data
use_cases.description: Automatically upload instrument data, images, and analysis results to electronic lab notebooks for permanent records

use_cases.title: Backup research notebooks
use_cases.description: Schedule automated backups of all laboratory notebooks to prevent data loss and ensure compliance

use_cases.title: Connect research tools
use_cases.description: Build pipelines that move data from Jupyter, REDCap, and other tools into LabArchives automatically

prompt_templates.title: List accessible notebooks
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the LabArchives skill to list all notebooks accessible to user [email]

prompt_templates.title: Create experiment entry
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a new LabArchives entry titled 'Experiment Results' with content '[description]' in notebook [nbid]

prompt_templates.title: Upload attachment
prompt_templates.prompt: Upload the file /path/to/data.csv as an attachment to entry [entry_id] in notebook [nbid]

prompt_templates.title: Backup all notebooks
prompt_templates.prompt: Backup all LabArchives notebooks to a local 'backups' directory with timestamps

output_examples.input: Backup notebook 12345 to JSON format without attachments
Create entry titled PCR Results with sample data
Upload experiment data files to notebook

best_practices: Store credentials in environment variables or secure config files never in code
Add config.yaml to .gitignore to prevent credential exposure in version control
Implement 1-2 second delays between API calls to avoid rate limiting
anti_patterns: Hardcoding credentials in scripts or sharing them in documentation
Ignoring file permissions when creating configuration files
Making excessive API requests without implementing rate limiting

faq.question: Which LabArchives API endpoints are supported?
What file types can be uploaded as attachments?
faq.answer: Documents (PDF, DOCX, TXT), images (PNG, JPG, TIFF), data files (CSV, XLSX, HDF5), and scientific formats (CIF, MOL, PDB)

faq.question: Does this integrate with Jupyter notebooks?
faq.answer: Yes. Export Jupyter notebooks to HTML then create LabArchives entries. Include the original .ipynb file as an attachment for reproducibility.

faq.question: Is my data sent anywhere other than LabArchives?
faq.answer: No. All API calls go directly to LabArchives servers. Local backups are stored on your machine only.

faq.question: Why am I getting 401 authentication errors?
faq.answer: Verify access_key_id and access_password from your administrator. Ensure you are using the external applications password, not your regular login password.

faq.question: How does this compare to using the LabArchives web interface?
faq.answer: This skill enables automation and bulk operations not possible in the web interface. Manual entry creation and small file uploads work best in the web interface.
